title: Calories in 3 Scrambled Eggs
meta_description: Discover calories in 3 scrambled eggs, including protein, fat, carbs, full nutrition breakdown, and preparation tweaks for better tracking.
assumptions: Large eggs (~50 g each), scrambled with 1 tsp butter total, no added milk, cheese, salt, or other ingredients.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by egg size, added fats, cooking method, and extras like milk or cheese. Check recipes or labels for precision.

quick_answer.text: Three large scrambled eggs offer ~273 kcal and ~19 g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

faqs.q: How many calories in one scrambled egg?
faqs.a: About 91 kcal for one large scrambled egg with minimal butter.

faqs.q: What is the protein in 3 scrambled eggs?
Do scrambled eggs have a lot of fat?
faqs.a: Yes, ~20 g total fat for 3 eggs, mostly from the yolks and cooking butter.

faqs.q: How does adding milk affect calories in scrambled eggs?
faqs.a: Adds ~10 kcal per tbsp per egg; use low-fat milk to minimize.

faqs.q: Are scrambled eggs higher in calories than boiled?
faqs.a: Yes, due to added cooking fatâ€”boiled are ~78 kcal each vs. 91 kcal scrambled.
